sections.title: Installation
sections.content:
By default, the MTRR size is not set correctly and the MDS bug is present. To set the MTRR size correctly and avoid memory loss, set the following kernel parameters:

```
enable_mtrr_cleanup mtrr_spare_reg_nr=1 mtrr_gran_size=32M mtrr_chunk_size=128M
```

To mitigate MDS, add mds=full,nosmt. The nosmt option disables simultaneous multi-threading so if the decrease in performance is too much, use mds=full instead.

sections.title: BIOS update
sections.content:
BIOS updates are only done manually:

1. Download the latest BIOS image
1. Plug in a USB drive and format it to FAT32 Find the USB drive's name with fdisk -l Install dosfstools Format the USB drive to FAT32
1. Copy K55VDAS.xxx file to the USB drive
1. Restart the PC and open BIOS with F2
1. Get to the Advanced menu
1. Select Start Easy Flash
1. Select the K55VDAS.xxx with arrow keys and enter.

1. Find the USB drive's name with fdisk -l
1. Install dosfstools
1. Format the USB drive to FAT32

sections.title: UEFI Shell
sections.content: Few ASUS laptops (and also K55VD) provide an option called Launch EFI Shell from filesystem device. It is not accessible by default but can be accessible by following the given instructions at Unified Extensible Firmware Interface#Launching UEFI Shell
